str2: And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.

word: we are out of our mind,
parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From ek and histemi; to put out of wits, i.e. Astound, or become astounded, insane.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
And if, whether. From ei and te; if too.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To be of sound mind, be sober-minded, exercise self-control. From sophron; to be of sound mind, i.e. Sane, moderate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
